BBEX3.A.SDG.EUR.CA.AB.A04: Exchange rates for the euro in Sudan / EUR 1 = SDG ... (selling)

General: The Sudanese pound (SDG) has been in circulation since 10 January 2007, when it was introduced at a rate of SDD 100 = SDG 1. The SDD remained legal tender alongside the SDG until 30 June 2007. Exchange rates until 2006, see BBEX2:A:SDD:EUR:CA:AB:A04.
Source: Central Bank of Sudan (Bank of Sudan), Khartoum
Methodology: Calculated on the basis of month-end rates.

Comment on 2007: The Sudanese pound (SDG) has been in circulation since 10 January 2007, when it was introduced at a rate of SDD 100 = SDG 1. Until 30 June 2007, exchange rates were listed in SDD (Sudanese dinar); these exchange rates were included in the calculation at the rate of the currency conversion.

Comment on 2012: The Sudanese pound was devalued on 25 June 2012. We recorded the following exchange rates (buying/selling): 24 June 2012: EUR 1 = SDG 3.3570 / 3.3738 25 June 2012: EUR 1 = SDG 5.5414 / 5.5691 Calculated devaluation: 39.4%.

Comment on 2013: The Sudanese pound was devalued on 24 September 2013. We recorded the following exchange rates (buying/selling): 23 September 2013: EUR 1 = SDG 5.9487 / 5.9785 24 September 2013: EUR 1 = SDG 7.6533 / 7.6916 Calculated devaluation: 22.3%.
